turns.speaker: KRIEGER
turns.text: That's not it.  That's not the list.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What's the matter, you don't know this trick?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: IS THERE ANY PARTICULAR REASON WE'RE NOT OUT OF HERE YET?!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Give me the God damn gum.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: He's got it.  Saved your ass again Jack.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: In position.  Jack open the door, let the package roll.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Stairway, youíre wrapped, go to transport.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: OK.  Taking Golitsyn's exit.  Jack, open the doors.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: What about my coat?  I'll freeze.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: The package is in the open.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Jim.  Jim.  Heís in the open.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Sarah eye on the package.  Jim, Iím coming to you.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Jim gave an abort, we should walk away.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: No, weíre going to recover the disk, understand?!  Now move!

turns.speaker: MATTHIAS
turns.text: Would you remove your hat please?

turns.speaker: MATTHIAS
turns.text: You wish to meet Max?  This is the price of admission.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I thought I was going to see Max.

turns.speaker: MATTHIAS
turns.text: You misunderstood.  No one sees Max.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Then what am I doing here?

turns.speaker: MATTHIAS
turns.text: Allowing Max to see you and hear what you've got to say.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I don't communicate very well through a shroud.

turns.speaker: MATTHIAS
turns.text: If Max doesn't like what you have to say, you'll be wearing that shroud indefinitely.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I'm willing to take the chance.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I'd say you've got about two minutes.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Yeah, well, Jim, fact is I've got more than ninety days leave coming.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: A hundred and sixty-seven, I think it is. Take it all, if you want.  <u>After</u> this one.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: I thought I'd take some now.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: What the hell's made you decide to take your leave at the worst possible time? Claire's in a weird mood too.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: I don't know, I had to go to Chicago again.  You were in Kiev.  You tell me.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: When you started noticing your short term memory loss.  What <u>the problem was</u> you and Claire had in Kiev?

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Ah, God, forget it.  What are we talking burnout here?

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Because I can't afford it. And because you'd burn up before you'd burn out.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Wonderful.  Ran into a convention of auto dealers at the Drake Hotel.  You hear the one about the astronaut who comes back from the first manned flight to Mars after two years?  His wife's got a year old kid.  So he says "All right.  Who was it?  My friend Harry?"  She says no. "Oh, it was my friend Sammy."  She says it wasn't Sammy.  "Oh, I suppose it was my friend Lou."  "No, what's the matter, don't you think I have any friends of my own?!"

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Isn't he chairing the Armed Services hearing?

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Not this week. This week he's flyfishing at the Oughterard Slough in County Kildare, with one of our best Irish guides.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: He won't be back in a hurry?

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: No, not in a hurry.  What do you think? You think the plot'll work?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Sure.  If the main character does.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: If you were me, Ethan, who would <u>you</u> trust to make him believable?

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Jack's pinned down Sarah.  Should be a second.  Keep dancing.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: We were forced to tie him to my best stallion and drag him around the barn a few times.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: About two hundred yards from the bridge.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Theyíre covering this frequency, Ethan. Cut all radio communications.  Repeat. Cut all radio communications.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: ..the next day I managed to drag myself to the safe house, must've just missed you..anyway, I checked our aliases.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: - and picked us up in the States -

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: - but you left before I could get there and I could check just so many places..

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Yeah, smaller countries don't computerize customs records -

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: - so I watched Europe. Once you showed up in England..it was easy.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: You knew I liked the rentals at Liverpool Street.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Jim, who do you think you're kidding?  A doctor's gotta look at that.  You can't sit up straight.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: I can sit up straight. I just can't..sit up straight very well. It's not important! I saw who shot me. Ethan, I saw the mole. It was Kittridge. Kittridge!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Kitteridge.  Oh my god!  Kittridge is the mole?

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: ..when you think about it, Ethan, it was inevitable..no more Cold War. No more secrets you keep from everyone but yourself, operations you answer to no one but yourself. Then one morning you wake up and find out the President of the United States is running the country - without your permission. The son-of-a- bitch! How dare he? You realize itís over, youíre an obsolete piece of hardware not worth upgrading, youíve got a lousy marriage and sixty-two grand a year. Kittridge, weíll go after that no good son-of-a-bitch, big time!

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: We donít have to, Jim.  Heíll come after us.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Whatís going to make him do that?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: What he didnít get in Prague.  The NOC list.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: A meeting tomorrow on the TGV, enroute to Paris.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Tight security.  No guns.  Real plus.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: If I supposedly deliver the NOC list to Max, Max has agreed to deliver Job to me. Iíll have Claire and Luther Stickell with me on the train.  Marcel Krieger will have helicopter transport waiting in Paris.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: I was sitting in a cafe waiting for you and suddenly there she was, standing in the rain just outside the safe house..alive and beautiful..and thinking Iím dead and gone.  God knows what sheís had to do forget about me to keep going and get the job done, I..

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: - no.  She canít know about me.  No one can.  Not til this is over.  Thereís too much at stake, Ethan.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Once we leave the safehouse, get in there and crash.  Iíll call you from Paris.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Before London.  But after you took the Bible out of the Drake Hotel in Chicago.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: They stamped it, didnít they?  Those damn Gideons.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: But, he didnít know about you.  In all fairness, Ethan, Claire was never convinced her charms would work with you. But I was supremely confident - having tastes the goods.  "Thou shall not covet thy Neighbourís wife", Ethan.  Oh, Ethan is in love with you, Claire, make no mistake about it.  And like all the worldís lovers, heís tortured by the same, one pathetic question - "does she feel the same way I do?"

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Tell me something Claire, that night in Prague, was it you or Jim that blew up the car and scattered Hannah all over town?

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Arenít you going to thank me Jim.  Ten million is better than six.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Donít flatter yourself - six was for <u>Eastern Europe</u>.  You made a lousy deal - ten for the world?  What is that?  But I needed you for the transfer with Max.  I got a little extra change;  and you got a little extra too.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Sorry Ethan.  Times up.  Say goodbye.

turns.speaker: ETHAN
turns.text: Youíre wrong about one thing.  Iím not the only one whoís seen you alive.

turns.speaker: PHELPS
turns.text: Ethan - Iíve always taught you, nothing can be more dangerous than the truth.  It can kill you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Look to your right, then back to me. There's a camera built right into the bridge.  Whatever you see it sees and transmits it back here.  Can you hear me?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Of course I can hear you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, in your...ear piece. You have a lovely smile . Can you hear me now?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why don't you take a look?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's what we do isn't it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Too wicked to have a drink later?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I think I might just take that look.

turns.speaker: MATTHIAS
turns.text: Twenty-six, twenty-seven.  So far so good.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: That's not so good for you, my friend.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Doesn't mean it's a signal.  Could just be the hard drive heating up.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: How long until we reach the Chunnel?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Is something wrong with the phone?  Well is something wrong with the batteries?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Run it through from the top.

turns.speaker: AVA
turns.text: Oh, you're not going. You're staying.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: Just across the bay, at the fuel depot. The men wanted to try to get home. I can't explain.

turns.speaker: AVA
turns.text: Then, I suppose the time has come say it's been nice Dwight Lionel. It's been everything. Oh, Dwight, I'm frightened.

turns.speaker: GREGORY
turns.text: I know, I am so sorry for so many things. I love you, Moira. I love you. I love you.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: Hello, Bobo. How are you tonight?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: We will both have the Salad Ticino.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: And I'll have the special fish.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: No, I want to see the dessert cart.

turns.speaker: BOBO
turns.text: I forgot to bring the champagne, Mr. Johnny.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: I forgot to wave. We'll have it at the wedding.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're not gonna marry him, Cosmo. Do you love him, Loretta?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're rich as Roosevelt. You're just cheap, Cosmo.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: He didn't used to be cheap. He thinks if he holds on to his money, he will never die.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: I don't wanna talk about it.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Well, what do you wanna talk about!

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: I don't know, Rose. I don't know where I've been, and I don't know where I'm going.  You should have your eyes opened for you, my friend.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I just want you to know. No matter what you do. You are going to die, just like everybody else.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Cosmo, this is Ronny, Johnny's brother.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Have I been a good wife?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I want you to stop seeing her.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: A man... under stands one day... that his life is built on nothing. And that's a bad, crazy day.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Your life is not built on nothing. Ti amo.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: I don't wanna talk about it.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Johnny Cammareri. I think it's great and about time. What's she gonna do with the rest of her life she don't get married?

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: I don't wanna talk about it.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I never seen anybody so in love like Cosmo back then! He'd stand outside the house all day and look in the windows. I never told you this cause it's not really a story. But one time I woke up in the middle of the night cause this bright light was in my face. Like a flashlight. I couldn't think a what it was. I looked out the window, and it was the moon! Big as a house! I never seen the moon so big before or since. I was almost scared, like it was gonna crush the house. And I looked down, and standing there in the street was Cosmo, looking up at the windows. This is the funny part. I got mad at you, Cosmo! I thought you brought this big moon over to my house cause you were so in love and woke me up with it. I was half asleep I guess and didn't know no better.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: You were altogether asleep. You were dreaming.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: You do, huh? Stick around. Don't go on any long trips.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: I don't know what you mean.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: I know you don't. That's the point. I'll say no more.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: And that's how much I'm saying.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: I can't sleep anymore. It's too much like death.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: You did this once it didn't work out.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: He got hit by a bus.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: No! Bad luck! Your Ma and I been married fifty-two years an nobody died. You were married, what, two years, and somebody is dead. Don't get married again, Loretta. It don't work out for you. Who's the man?

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: Him? He's a big baby. Why isn't he here with you telling me?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: He's flying to Sicily. His mother's dying.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: More Bad Luck! I don't like his face, Loretta. I don't like his lips. When he smiles I can't see his teeth. When will you do it?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You've got to come. You've got to give me away.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: I didn't give you away the first time.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: And maybe that's why I had the Bad Luck. Maybe if you gave me away, and I got married in a church, in a wedding dress, instead of at the City Hall with strangers standing outside the door, maybe then I wouldn't had the Bad Luck I had.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I didn't have no wedding cake, no reception or nothing. Johnny got down on his knees and proposed to me at The Grand Ticino.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: That don't sound like Johnny. Where's the ring?

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: It looks stupid. It's a pinky ring. It's a man's ring.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: Everything is temporary. That don't excuse nothing.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: So you'll come to the wedding, right?

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: What'd you do to your hair?

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: Who is this man? You're engaged!

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: You're my daughter. I won't have you acting like a tramp!

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: Alright. I didn't see you here.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I don't know whether I saw you or not.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: And then there is copper, which is the only pipe I use. It costs money. But it costs money because it saves money.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: The man understood me. The woman wanted to be cheap, but the man saw that I was right.

turns.speaker: MONA
turns.text: You have such a head for knowing. You know everything.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: They are little stars and birds. Birds fly to the stars, I guess.

turns.speaker: MONA
turns.text: You haven't once said you like my dress.

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: I like your dress.  It's very bright.

turns.speaker: MONA
turns.text: Why you looking around so much?

turns.speaker: COSMO
turns.text: I don't know. I got a feeling.

turns.speaker: FELIX
turns.text: It's wrong to just let them go.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: What do you want me to do? Pick up after five dogs? I'm eighty-three years old. God in his heaven understands that I cannot pick up after five dogs.

turns.speaker: FELIX
turns.text: I won't have to shoot those dogs. They will kill each other.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: You think so, huh, Stupid? Those dogs love each other.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: At dinner, my daughter-in-law threatened to kill me. Things are very bad in my house.

turns.speaker: FELIX
turns.text: We're supposed to do fifty apples. We only got twelve done.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: I don't know what to advise my son. I think he should pay for the wedding, but it is important that he don't look ridiculous.

turns.speaker: FELIX
turns.text: Hurry up, hurry up. We open in five minutes.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I'm calling for your brother Johnny. He's getting married and he wants you to come.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: What's wrong can never be made right.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Let me come and talk to you.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: Have you come from my brother?

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: You are going to marry my brother?

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: I have no life. My brother Johnny took my life from me.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: Gimme the big knife! I'm gonna cut my throat!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Maybe I should come back another time.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: No, I want you to see this! I want you to watch me kill myself so you can tell my brother on his wedding day! Chrissy, gimme the big knife!

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: It's wood. It's fake. Five years ago I was engaged to be married. Johnny came in here, he ordered bread from me. I put it in the slicer and I talked with him and my hand got caught cause I wasn't paying attention. The slicer chewed off my hand. It's funny 'cause - when my fiancé saw that I was maimed, she left me for another man.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: That's the bad blood between you and Johnny?

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: I don't care! I ain't no freakin monument to justice! I lost my hand, I lost my bride! Johnny has his hand, Johnny has his bride! You come in here and you want me to put away my heartbreak and forget?

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: You don't have to help me.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I know that. I do what I want.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You'll eat this bloody to feed your blood.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: He knew my husband who died.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: So. Five years ago your hand got cut off and your woman left you for another man. No woman since then?

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: When your husband get hit by the bus?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: No. Unlucky. I have not been lucky.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: I don't care about Luck, you understand me? It ain't that.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: What? Do you think you're the only one ever shed a tear?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You got any whiskey? How 'bout giving me a glass of whiskey?

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: She was right to leave me.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You really are stupid, you know that.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: You don't know nothing about it.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I was raised that a girl gets married young. I didn't get married until I was twenty-eight. I met a man. I loved him. I married him. He wanted to have a baby right away. I said no. Then he got hit by a bus. No man. No baby. No nothing! I did not know that man was a gift I could not keep. I didn't know... You tell me a story and you think you know what it means, but I see what the true story is, and you can't.  She didn't leave you! You can't see what you are. I can see everything. You are a wolf!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: The big part of you has no words and it's-a wolf. This woman was a trap for you. She caught you and you could not get away.  So you chewed off your foot! That was the price you had to pay to be free.  Johnny had nothing to do with it. You did what you had to do, between you and you, and I know I'm right, I don't care what you say. And now you're afraid because you found out the big part of you is a wolf that has the courage to bite off its own hand to save itself from the trap of the wrong love. That's why there has been no woman since that wrong woman. You are scared to death what the wolf will do if you make that mistake again!

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: Why are you marrying Johnny? He's a fool!

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: He made me look the wrong way and I cut off my hand. He could make you look the wrong way and you could cut off your whole head!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I am looking where I should to become a bride!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Oh. Oh God. I don't care about anything. I don't care about anything! Take me to the bed.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: I can't believe what is happening.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: All my life I have never reached a man. I knew that I would reach my husband, but I took my time and he was dead. Ronny.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I want to cut you open and crawl inside of you. I want you to swallow me.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Get all of me. Take everything.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You're mad at him, take it out on me, take your revenge on me! Take everything, leave nothing for him to marry! Hollow me out so there's nothing left but the skin over my bones. Suck me dry!

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: Alright. Alright. There will be nothing left.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: I don't know. I think it's the moon.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I've never seen a moon like that.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: It makes you look like an angel.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: This time I was trying to do everything right.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I thought if I stayed away from the City Hall, I won't have that Bad Luck I had again.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: You're trying to make me feel guilty.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: All right, I'm guilty. I confess!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You're invited to the wedding! It's in a few weeks. Why didn't you do like him and be with your dying mother in Palermo?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You don't get along with anybody!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: That's impossible! It was ruint when I got here! You ruint my life!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Oh yes, oh yes you did! You've got those bad eyes like a gypsy! Why didn't I see it yesterday! Bad Luck! Is that all I'm ever gonna have? Why didn't I just pick up a stone and kill myself years and years ago? I'm gonna marry him!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Last night never happened, you hear me? I'm gonna marry him anyway and last night never happened, and you and I are gonna take this to our coffins!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Alright. Then I must never see you again. The bad blood will have to stay there between you and Johnny for all time. You won't come to the wedding.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: But he wants me to come!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: But that's cause he don't know!

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: Alright. I will not come. Provided one thing.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: That you come with me tonight. Once. To the Opera.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: I love two things. I love you, and I love the Opera. If I can have the two things that I love together for one night, I will be satisfied to give up the rest of my life.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: Alright. Meet me at the Met.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I thought I'd try it.  You look good.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: He was having some fun. Yeah, well he's dead.  Come on, let's go in.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: I don't know. For your hair. For your beautiful dress. For... you know, I feel like a man again. You know I love the Opera. You know it's been a long time since I've been to the Opera.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: They get some turnout for this stuff.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: It's the best thing there is.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I like parts of it, but I don't really get it.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I couldn't believe it! I didn't think she was going to die. I knew she was sick...
